study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effect of stretching intervention on muscle tension, fatigue, strength, and lactic acid levels in fish transport workers.
results_summary: The study found a significant increase in lactic acid levels and fatigue, a non-significant increase in muscle tension, and a significant decrease in muscle strength after the stretching intervention.
population_specificity: Male fish transport workers at the Tawang fish auction, Weleri, Central Java, Indonesia.
effective_dosage: 1.5-minute stretching exercises before and during work every two hours.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of a novel facial stretching technique combined with structured exercise versus conventional exercise on facial symmetry and function in acute Bell's palsy patients.
results_summary: The experimental group (facial stretching + structured exercise) showed significantly greater improvement in facial symmetry and function (measured by SFGS) compared to the conventional exercise group (p = 0.002). The novel technique demonstrated promising results for enhancing recovery in acute Bell's palsy.
population_specificity: Patients with acute Bell's palsy in Mangalore, India (n=24, 12 per group).
effective_dosage: Not specified (structured exercise program details not provided).
study_duration: 3 weeks (with assessments at baseline, 10th day, and 20th day).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of an application-linked stretching ball versus a traditional simple stretching ball in treating plantar fasciitis.
results_summary: The study found no significant improvement in MOXFQ scores for either group over time, and no significant difference in efficacy between the application-linked and traditional stretching balls.
population_specificity: Fourteen participants with plantar fasciitis persisting for at least six months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of supervised static stretching versus home-based stretching on pectoralis muscle strength performance.
results_summary: Both supervised and home-based stretching groups showed large magnitude increases in dynamic maximal strength compared to the control group, with no significant differences between the two intervention groups. Force development remained unaffected by the stretching interventions.
population_specificity: Sixty-three recreational participants.
effective_dosage: 15 minutes of pectoralis stretching, 4 days per week.

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to determine the diagnostic and interventional approach for myocardial infarction in individuals with situs inversus totalis.
results_summary: The study emphasized the importance of ECG recording with right precordial leads for diagnosis and recommended standard coronary angiography and intervention with inverted maneuvers and radiographic projections.
population_specificity: Individuals with situs inversus totalis and suspected myocardial infarction.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether stretching affects fascia stiffness and its contribution to increased range of motion (ROM), comparing static and dynamic stretching.
results_summary: Static stretching reduced both muscle and fascia stiffness, while dynamic stretching did not. Both stretching types increased ROM in the knee-to-wall test, but not in isolated ROM testing. Fascia stiffness changes correlated slightly with ROM improvements, unlike muscle stiffness.
population_specificity: 40 recreationally active participants (25 male, 15 female).
effective_dosage: 5 minutes of static or dynamic plantar flexor stretching.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the acute effects of percussion massage and static stretching on hamstring flexibility and range of motion.
results_summary: Both percussion massage and static stretching significantly improved hamstring flexibility and range of motion, with no statistically significant difference between the two interventions. The effects were acute, measured 30 minutes post-intervention.
population_specificity: 54 healthy individuals aged 18-25 years with at least 15 degrees of active knee extension.
study_duration: Acute (single session, measured pre- and 30 minutes post-intervention)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of stretching (as an active control) versus HIIT on stress response and emotional well-being in emotionally impulsive adults.
results_summary: Stretching did not improve aerobic fitness but increased post-stress joy, reduced tension and worries, and enhanced perceived general self-efficacy, similar to HIIT. No significant differences were found between stretching and HIIT in psychoneuroendocrine stress response.
population_specificity: Sedentary, emotionally impulsive adults (average age 30.69 ± 8.20 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of an at-home high-intensity stretch (HIS) device to traditional physical therapy (PT) and combination therapy for treating adhesive capsulitis.
results_summary: The HIS device improved range of motion (ROM) and functional scores (ASES and SST) more effectively than PT alone, with the HIS group restoring >95% of contralateral ROM. All groups showed significant improvement from baseline.
population_specificity: Thirty-four patients with idiopathic adhesive capsulitis and a minimum of 12 months follow-up.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether adding thoracic manipulation to posterior glenohumeral mobilizations (PGM) or sleeper stretches improves passive range of motion (PROM), joint mobility, and infraspinatus EMG activity in individuals with decreased shoulder internal rotation.
results_summary: Both PGM and sleeper stretches improved internal rotation and horizontal adduction PROM in a single session, but adding thoracic manipulation resulted in smaller gains in these outcomes. No significant differences were found between groups for horizontal adduction PROM, humeral head translation, or EMG activity.
population_specificity: Forty individuals with clinically significant internal rotation loss in the shoulder.
effective_dosage: Five 30-second bouts of either PGM or sleeper stretching, followed by a supine HVLA manipulation targeting T3-4 in the second session.
study_duration: Two study sessions separated by a seven-day washout period.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of home-based multimodal prehabilitation, which may include stretching, in reducing patient-reported disability and postoperative complications in older people with frailty undergoing major surgery.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding stretching's effects, as it focuses on the trial's design and objectives rather than outcomes.
population_specificity: Older people (>60 years) with frailty undergoing major surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how variations in video-vignette introduction format and camera focus influence participants' engagement with a video vignette depicting a bad news consultation.
results_summary: The study found that an audiovisual introduction combined with alternating camera focus on the patient's emotional moments resulted in the highest levels of emotional engagement. The physician-only variant led to lower emotional engagement when paired with an audiovisual introduction.
population_specificity: 181 students acting as analogue patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether protein-pacing with food protein (FP) was comparable to whey protein (WP) supplementation during multimodal RISE training (including stretching) for improving physical performance and cardiometabolic health in overweight/obese individuals.
results_summary: Both WP and FP combined with RISE training (including stretching) significantly improved physical performance and cardiometabolic health markers, with no difference between protein sources.
population_specificity: Overweight/obese individuals
effective_dosage: Not specified for stretching (protein-pacing: six meals/day @ 1.4 g/kg BW)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of stretching as part of pulmonary rehabilitation for COVID-19 patients to improve symptoms and quality of life.
results_summary: The study suggests that stretching, along with other interventions, may help improve dyspnea, reduce complications, and enhance function in COVID-19 patients, but specific outcomes for stretching alone are not detailed.
population_specificity: COVID-19 patients, particularly those undergoing acute management or post-hospitalization rehabilitation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of various interventions, including stretching, for preventing ankle ligament injuries or sprains in physically active individuals.
results_summary: The study found limited evidence for the effectiveness of stretching in reducing ankle sprains, with data reporting issues limiting interpretation of results for many interventions, including stretching.
population_specificity: Physically active individuals from adolescence to middle age, predominantly young adults participating in high-risk sports.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of stretching and toning (control intervention) combined with omega-3 fatty acid supplementation versus a target intervention (aerobic exercise, cognitive stimulation, and omega-3 supplementation) on cognitive function and gray matter volume in MCI patients.
results_summary: The study found that stretching and toning combined with omega-3 supplementation did not prevent gray matter volume loss in AD-related brain regions, unlike the target intervention. No significant differences in cognitive performance or other metabolic/inflammatory parameters were observed between the groups.
population_specificity: Patients with mild cognitive impairment (MCI), aged 60-80 years (8 females, 14 males).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of a stretching/flexibility program combined with a placebo against a multifaceted intervention (exercise + supplements) on cognitive and physical outcomes in older adults with subjective memory impairment.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in cognitive or physical function outcomes between the stretching/placebo group and the intervention group at 6 or 12 months. The intervention group showed improved lean mass, but stretching alone did not demonstrate measurable benefits in the studied outcomes.
population_specificity: Community-dwelling older adults with subjective memory impairment (mean age 70.2 years, 70% female).
effective_dosage: Not specified for stretching (control condition involved stretching/flexibility sessions combined with placebo).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if a supervised multicomponent exercise program (including stretching) could reverse frailty and improve functionality, cognition, emotional state, social networking, and biomarkers in frail older adults.
results_summary: The multicomponent exercise program, which included stretching, significantly improved functional measurements, cognitive and emotional states, social networking, and frailty biomarkers while reducing primary care visits compared to the control group.
population_specificity: Sedentary, frail older adults (aged ~80) with gait speed <0.8 m/s from rural primary care centers in Spain.
effective_dosage: 65 minutes per session, 5 days per week (including proprioception, aerobic, strength, and stretching exercises).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the dual functional potential of Strontium-based nanoparticles (SrNPs) in bone regeneration and antimicrobial resistance, focusing on synthesis methods, biological interactions, and translational applications.
results_summary: The study found that SrNPs promote osteogenesis, enhance bone healing, and exhibit strong antimicrobial activity against multidrug-resistant pathogens, positioning them as promising therapeutic agents for bone-related diseases and AMR. The review also highlighted the need for further preclinical and clinical evaluations to ensure safety and efficacy.
population_specificity: Not specified (broad focus on potential applications in healthcare, particularly orthopedic and antimicrobial therapies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the structural, optical, and electrochemical properties of strontium-doped titanium dioxide nanoparticles for enhancing photocatalytic and supercapacitive performance.
results_summary: Sr-TiO2 nanoparticles demonstrated high photocatalytic efficiency (94.48% MO removal in 100 min and 97.89% Con-R removal in 70 min) and improved electrochemical performance, including enhanced specific capacitance and stability.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro study on nanomaterials).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of strontium cream in alleviating pruritus in patients with hidradenitis suppurativa (HS).
results_summary: The study found a significant reduction in itching symptoms post-intervention, with mean itch scores decreasing from 3.80 to 2.28 (p<0.001). Participant feedback indicated overall satisfaction, with 84% willing to recommend the cream to other HS patients.
population_specificity: Fifty participants with hidradenitis suppurativa (HS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the multifaceted role of strontium ion (Sr2+) in regenerative medicine, particularly its effects on biological processes and applications in various tissue regeneration.
results_summary: The study found that Sr2+ plays a critical role in osteogenesis, angiogenesis, immune modulation, and antioxidative defense, and is effective in regenerating diverse tissues, including bone, cartilage, and skin. It also highlighted the advantages and limitations of Sr-containing biomaterials (SrBMs) in regenerative medicine.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing studies)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the optimal concentration of silver (Ag) in a strontium (Sr)-incorporated titanium material for antibacterial activity and biocompatibility.
results_summary: CaSr50mMAg-Ti showed high antibacterial activity and anti-inflammatory effects in vivo while maintaining bone-bonding ability, though higher Ag concentrations inhibited cell proliferation and differentiation in vitro. CaSr10mMAg-Ti exhibited inconsistent antibacterial activity.
population_specificity: Rat models (subcutaneous infection and femur implantation) and MC3T3-E1 cells (in vitro).
effective_dosage: CaSr1mMAg-Ti, CaSr10mMAg-Ti, CaSr50mMAg-Ti (concentrations based on Ag ion loading).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop strontium silicate biomaterials with enhanced antibacterial and osteogenic properties for bone regeneration in osteoporosis.
results_summary: Higher ammonia concentrations produced smaller SrSiO3 and Sr2SiO4 particles with improved antibacterial efficacy, radiopacity, and osteogenic activity in hMSCs, while modulating macrophage polarization.
population_specificity: Human mesenchymal stem cells (hMSCs), RAW 264.7 macrophages, and bacterial cultures (E. coli and S. aureus).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the hydrogen distribution and ionic conductivity in hydrogen-doped SrFeO3-δ films under different strain conditions for potential use in fuel cells and other electrochemical applications.
results_summary: The study found that compressively strained HSrFeO3-δ films exhibited anomalous uphill hydrogen distribution and high ionic conductivity (0.189 S/cm at 413 K), making them suitable for low-temperature electrochemical applications. The strain state significantly influenced hydrogen accommodation and ionic transport in the material.
population_specificity: Not applicable (material science study, no human or animal subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a novel adsorbent material (OSA@CF/Zr) for rapid and selective recovery of Sr²⁺ from nuclear wastewater and contaminated water.
results_summary: The OSA@CF/Zr demonstrated rapid Sr²⁺ adsorption (0.415 mmol g⁻¹ within 6 min), high reusability (retained ~0.26 mmol g⁻¹ after 17 cycles), and selectivity (minimal interference from co-existing ions). It effectively removed >95% of Sr²⁺ from simulated surface water in continuous column operation.
population_specificity: Simulated surface water and nuclear wastewater (no human or animal subjects).
effective_dosage: Not applicable (adsorbent material used, not Sr²⁺ dosage).
study_duration: Not specified (adsorption tests conducted over minutes to cycles).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a strontium-doped zinc oxide composite (SZ@PDA) for caries prevention, remineralization, and tooth staining improvement.
results_summary: The study found that SZ@PDA, under yellow light and ultrasound, generated reactive oxygen species to destroy bacterial membranes and decompose pigments, while strontium ions promoted enamel and dentin remineralization. The system effectively prevented caries and improved tooth staining.
population_specificity: Not specified (likely in vitro or preclinical study based on abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to synthesize a new strontium-quercetin complex and evaluate its potential for bone regeneration in vitro and in vivo.
results_summary: The strontium-quercetin complex enhanced osteogenic differentiation in vitro, increasing alkaline phosphatase activity and extracellular matrix mineralization. In vivo, it reduced bone lesions in mice after 7 days.
population_specificity: Preosteoblastic cell line (in vitro) and mice with periapical lesions (in vivo).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of Strontium (Sr2+) on human periodontal ligament stem cell (hPDLSC) proliferation and osteogenesis, as well as the relevant signaling pathways involved.
results_summary: A 0.01 mM Sr2+ concentration significantly enhanced hPDLSC proliferation and osteogenic differentiation, but these effects were reversed by inhibiting the canonical Wnt/β-catenin pathway with XAV939. The findings suggest Sr2+ may play a critical role in periodontal regeneration.
population_specificity: Human periodontal ligament stem cells (hPDLSCs) harvested from extracted premolars.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a novel strontium-based hemostatic powder (QCS@SrT-TA) in managing open bone defects by addressing bleeding, infection, inflammation, and bone healing.
results_summary: QCS@SrT-TA demonstrated rapid hemostasis, strong antibacterial effects, anti-inflammatory properties, and promoted angiogenesis, significantly improving bone healing in preclinical models.
population_specificity: Preclinical rat models (tail artery amputation and liver bleeding).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether phase/defect-engineered Strontium-based material (T-BSTO-Vo) could simultaneously achieve antibacterial action and promote innervated bone regeneration in MRSA-infected bone defects.
results_summary: The synthesized T-BSTO-Vo achieved 99.83% antibacterial efficiency against MRSA under ultrasound irradiation and promoted osteogenic differentiation of BMSCs via piezoelectric signals and Schwann cell neurogenic modulation, leading to effective innervated bone regeneration.
population_specificity: MRSA-infected bone defect model (preclinical study).
effective_dosage: Not specified (material tested under 1.5 W cm² ultrasound irradiation for 20 min).
study_duration: Not specified (intervention duration not detailed in abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a multifunctional hydrogel containing strontium carbonate (SrCO3) in promoting endometrial repair, angiogenesis, and reducing fibrosis in intrauterine adhesion (IUA).
results_summary: The hydrogel significantly improved endometrial thickness, gland number, and reduced fibrosis in both human cell models and a rat IUA model, while enhancing markers of proliferation and angiogenesis.
population_specificity: Human endometrial stromal cells (HESCs), human umbilical vein endothelial cells (HUVECs), and sexually mature female rats.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and evaluate a novel adsorbent (CB5-Ti3C2T2) for efficient removal of strontium ions from wastewater.
results_summary: The study found that CB5-Ti3C2T2 complexes, particularly CB5-Ti3C2O2, exhibited high adsorption affinity and selectivity for Sr ions, with strong synergistic effects between CB5 and Ti3C2T2. Experimental results confirmed high removal efficiency, with distribution coefficients and decontamination factors reaching 2.88 × 10⁵ mL/g and 144.9, respectively.
population_specificity: Strontium-containing wastewater (low concentrations)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether strontium (Sr) pretreatment could enhance the yield and therapeutic efficacy of synovial mesenchymal stem cell-derived exosomes (SMSC-EXOs) for treating temporomandibular joint osteoarthritis (TMJOA).
results_summary: Sr-pretreated SMSC-EXOs (Sr-SMSC-EXOs) showed superior therapeutic efficacy by reducing chondrocyte ferroptosis and osteoclast-mediated joint pain in TMJOA, with improved miRNA profiles favoring beneficial effects. The study identified Alix's role in Sr-triggered miRNA loading and highlighted miR-143-3p as a key anti-TMJOA component.
population_specificity: Synovium-derived mesenchymal stem cells (SMSCs) in the context of temporomandibular joint osteoarthritis (TMJOA).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the dosimetry of static overlapping fields versus continuous motion techniques in strontium-90 plesiotherapy to minimize over- and underdosed areas.
results_summary: Continuous motion technique resulted in more homogeneous dose distribution compared to static overlapping fields, with significant differences in dose homogeneity (p ≤ .01). The method effectiveness varied among operators and depended on the number of fields and dose drop-off at margins.
population_specificity: Not specified (implied to be operators performing the procedure).
effective_dosage: 1 Gy (100 cGy) for qualitative evaluation; 5 Gy (500 cGy) for quantitative data.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and evaluate a strontium-substituted nanocarrier (Sr-CA) for safe and efficient siRNA delivery in gene therapy.
results_summary: The Sr-CA nanocarrier demonstrated improved cellular uptake, pH-responsive cargo release, and effective gene silencing without significant cytotoxicity. Biocompatibility testing in mice confirmed its safety.
population_specificity: HEK-293 cells and mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of beta-ray brachytherapy (using 106Ru or 90Sr plaques) for treating retinoblastoma, focusing on tumor control, eye preservation, and radiation-induced complications.
results_summary: The study found that brachytherapy achieved complete tumor control in 82% of cases, with an eye retention rate of 91%. However, 33% of eyes experienced radiation-induced complications, including retinopathy, optic neuropathy, and vitreous hemorrhage.
population_specificity: 163 patients (186 eyes, 333 tumors) with intraocular retinoblastoma.
study_duration: Treatment period spanned from November 2007 to August 2023 (retrospective review).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the osteoregenerative potential of strontium (Sr2+) incorporated into mesoporous bioactive glasses (MBGs) in a large animal model (sheep) and its effects on bone formation, osteogenesis, and angiogenesis.
results_summary: Strontium incorporation enhanced osteoregeneration, increasing ossification areas (7% to 20%) and trabeculae thickness (15 μm to 30 μm). It also improved ALP activity, gene expression (Runx2, ALP, VEGF), and endothelial cell proliferation without affecting preosteoblast viability.
population_specificity: Sheep (large animal model) and in vitro MC3T3-E1 preosteoblasts and HUVEC cells.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a 3D-printed scaffold containing strontium-substituted mesoporous bioactive glass nanoparticles (Sr-MBGNPs) and icariin (ICN) for localized bone regeneration in osteoporosis.
results_summary: The scaffold demonstrated dual functionality by enhancing osteoblast proliferation and differentiation while inhibiting osteoclastogenesis, with sustained ion release and improved hydrophilicity and bioactivity. The study highlighted the scaffold's potential as a localized treatment strategy for osteoporosis with reduced systemic side effects.
population_specificity: Osteoporotic bone (in vitro or preclinical model, not specified for human subjects).
effective_dosage: Optimized Sr-MBGNP concentration (specific amount not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of strontium-substituted nanohydroxyapatite (SrHA) in 3D-printed bone substitutes for large bone defect repair.
results_summary: The study found that SrHA integrated into the PTMC matrix improved physicochemical and biological properties, enhancing bone regeneration and defect repair in rat models. Functionalized scaffolds showed increased osteoconductive and osteoinductive activity.
population_specificity: Rat models with large bone defects (4 mm) in tibial and cranial bones.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to synthesize and characterize strontium hydride and its derivatives, exploring their reactivity with various organic compounds.
results_summary: The study successfully isolated strontium hydride [(TpAd,iPr)Sr(μ-H)]2 and demonstrated its reactivity to form amide, hydroborate, and other strontium complexes, all well-characterized via NMR and X-ray analysis.
population_specificity: Chemical compounds in a laboratory setting (no human or animal subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the biomechanical and osseointegrative properties of 3D printed porous PEEK materials loaded with strontium (Sr) and alendronate (ALN) for potential use as bone implants.
results_summary: The study found that the PEEK-ALN-Sr composite material exhibited improved bone volume/total volume (BV/TV), trabecular spacing (TB.Sp), trabecular thickness (TB.Th), and trabeculae number (TB.N) compared to other groups, with more new bone tissue observed in the PEEK-ALN-Sr group. The material demonstrated stable pore size, porosity, and excellent elastic modulus, suggesting strong osseointegration potential.
population_specificity: New Zealand rabbits

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the action and mechanism of strontium ranelate (SR) in orthodontic tooth movement (OTM), particularly its effects on root resorption and tooth fixation.
results_summary: SR reduced osteoclast activity and improved root resorption in OTM rats, with these effects enhanced by silencing circBACH1 or elevating miR-155-5p. The study found that SR modulates the circBACH1/miR-155-5p pathway to ameliorate root resorption and tooth fixation during OTM.
population_specificity: Rats (animal model for orthodontic tooth movement)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether strontium-incorporated hydroxyapatite coatings improve osseointegration of titanium implants, particularly in osteoporotic conditions.
results_summary: Strontium-containing coatings (HapSr10, HapSr90) showed higher torque values in osteoporotic rats, indicating improved osseointegration, while hydroxyapatite alone performed better in healthy rats. Strontium incorporation may stimulate osteoblast activity and reduce osteoclastic resorption.
population_specificity: Healthy and osteoporotic female rats.
effective_dosage: 10 and 90 mol% of Sr²⁺ in relation to Ca²⁺.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of an all-inorganic polyoxoniobate framework (FZU-1) in selectively capturing and eluting radioactive 90Sr from high-level liquid waste.
results_summary: FZU-1 removed 98.9% of Sr²⁺ from simulated nuclear waste, outperforming other reported adsorbents, and enabled recycling by desorbing Sr²⁺ via selective Na⁺ loading. The rapid Sr²⁺ uptake was due to strong binding at concavity sites, while Na⁺ binding at tweezer sites facilitated elution.
population_specificity: Simulated nuclear liquid waste (no human or animal subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of strontium zinc silicate bioceramic (SZS) extract on osteoporosis and sarcopenia and explore its underlying mechanisms, particularly focusing on Piezo1-mediated intracellular Ca2+ changes.
results_summary: SZS extract prevented bone structure deterioration, muscle atrophy, and fibrosis in tail-suspended rats, upregulated Piezo1 mRNA expression, and promoted osteoblast and myoblast proliferation and differentiation via increased intracellular Ca2+ in a Piezo1-dependent manner.
population_specificity: Tail-suspended rat model (hindlimb unloading-induced osteoporosis and sarcopenia).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether micro-nano textured titanium implants functionalized with strontium (Sr) improve osseointegration in a pre-clinical rat model.
results_summary: The study found that strontium-functionalized implants (MNSr and MNSr+) enhanced osseointegration, particularly in cortical bone, with increased bone-implant contact and modulation of osteogenic gene expression. The removal torque test and histological analysis confirmed these benefits, especially at the 45-day mark.
population_specificity: Holtzman rats (64 animals, divided into four groups).
effective_dosage: Two levels of Sr2+ addition (MNSr and MNSr+), exact amounts not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the applications of strontium in dentistry, focusing on its effects on bone formation, antimicrobial properties, and dental material enhancements.
results_summary: Strontium inhibits bone resorption, increases bone deposition, improves radiopacity in dental materials, enhances antimicrobial and mechanical properties, promotes enamel remineralization, alleviates dentin hypersensitivity, and supports dentin regeneration.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of strontium applications in dentistry).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the impact of processing and thermochemical treatment conditions on the electrical conductivity of donor-doped strontium titanate ceramics for use in solid oxide fuel and electrolysis cells.
results_summary: The study found that dense donor-doped SrTiO3 ceramics exhibit sluggish oxygen diffusion, limiting reduction even at high temperatures, while porous structures achieve higher reduction and conductivity. Fine-grained ceramics showed lower conductivity due to resistive grain boundaries, whereas oxidized porous ceramics demonstrated faster reduction kinetics.
population_specificity: Not applicable (material science study, no human or animal subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the cytotoxicity and cell migration effects of a novel strontium silicate-based bioceramic material (CRoot SP) with calcium silicate-based (iRoot SP) and epoxide amine resin (AH Plus) sealers on stem cells derived from rat apical papilla (rSCAPs).
results_summary: CRoot SP showed less cytotoxicity than iRoot SP and AH Plus, particularly at higher concentrations (5 mg/mL and 10 mg/mL). Lower concentrations (0.02 mg/mL and 0.2 mg/mL) of CRoot SP promoted cell migration in rSCAPs, suggesting potential for better tissue repair in root canal treatment.
population_specificity: Stem cells derived from rat apical papilla (rSCAPs).
study_duration: Observations were made up to day 5.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the biological performance of bioglasses enriched with SrO for osteoinductive effects and their potential in bone regeneration and treating infected bone defects.
results_summary: The study found that bioglasses enriched with SrO were bioactive, non-cytotoxic, enhanced osteoblast proliferation, and showed potential for supporting bone regeneration. Particle size had less impact on biological performance than chemical composition.
population_specificity: In vitro testing on hFOB1.19 osteoblasts and bacterial strains (Pseudomonas aeruginosa and Staphylococcus aureus).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if strontium (Sr) encapsulated in composite nanoparticles could effectively induce chondrogenesis and enhance cartilage regeneration in an anti-inflammatory microenvironment.
results_summary: The study found that strontium-loaded nanoparticles (G5-Dic/Sr) significantly enhanced chondrogenesis in bone marrow stem cells (BMSCs) and improved cartilage formation in immunocompetent rabbits, with reduced inflammation compared to control groups.
population_specificity: Bone marrow stem cells (BMSCs) and immunocompetent rabbits.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop an electrochemical sensor using strontium molybdate with functionalized carbon nanotubes (SrMoO4@f-CNF) for sensitive and selective detection of acetaminophen.
results_summary: The SrMoO4@f-CNF nanocomposite demonstrated enhanced electrochemical properties, including low charge transfer resistance (85 Ω·cm²), a detection limit of 1.2 nM, and a wide response range (0.01-28.48 µM) for acetaminophen. The sensor showed good recovery in real-sample analysis using DPV and CV techniques.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro electrochemical study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to optimize the neo-angiogenic, antimicrobial, and regenerative properties of calcium silicate cements by infusing them with titanium and strontium while maintaining mechanical stability.
results_summary: The study confirmed successful infusion of strontium into calcium silicate cement, evidenced by mineral phase analysis and bioactive material formation. The resulting material demonstrated enhanced regenerative properties and excellent biocompatibility.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of liposomal etidronate as a treatment for strontium contamination compared to the reference treatment (calcium gluconate).
results_summary: The study found that liposomal etidronate suggested an interaction with strontium but was insufficient to change its biokinetics. The reference treatment (calcium gluconate) was significantly less effective than previously reported or showed no effectiveness.
population_specificity: Rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and evaluate composite 3D scaffolds containing strontium for bone tissue engineering, focusing on their osteogenic potential and biocompatibility.
results_summary: The study found that the 3D-printed scaffolds with strontium-containing nano-hydroxyapatite (SrHA) showed good cytocompatibility and osteogenic potential, particularly beneficial for faster mineralization in osteoporosis treatment.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro or preclinical study implied).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the impedance response and relaxation behavior of composite thin films of barium strontium titanate (BaxSr1-xTiO3) modified with magnesium oxide (MgO).
results_summary: The study found that films with 3 mol% MgO exhibited the least stretched relaxation function and an increase in capacitance. Non-Debye-type relaxation phenomena were observed across all samples, with varying trends in resistance and capacitance components based on MgO content.
population_specificity: Composite thin films deposited on stainless steel substrates.
effective_dosage: MgO concentrations ranged from 1 to 5 mol%.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the green synthesis of strontium nanoparticles using Mimosa pudica and assess their anti-inflammatory activity.
results_summary: The study found that Mimosa pudica-mediated strontium nanoparticles exhibited increasing anti-inflammatory effects with higher concentrations, comparable to the standard diclofenac sodium, across all three assays tested.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro assays only)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether doping titanium-based orthopedic implants with strontium (Sr) and zinc (Zn) enhances osseointegration and osteogenic differentiation of adipose-derived stem cells (ADSCs).
results_summary: The study found that TiO2 nanotube surfaces doped with Sr and Zn significantly improved ADSC adhesion, proliferation, growth, and osteogenic differentiation compared to unmodified surfaces, as evidenced by increased alkaline phosphatase activity, osteocalcin expression, and calcium phosphate mineralization.
population_specificity: Adipose-derived stem cells (ADSCs) in vitro.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the structural and biological effects of strontium on borate bioactive glass (BBG) and its potential for bone repair, particularly in treating osteomyelitis.
results_summary: Strontium-modified BBG showed enhanced pathogenic activity, with 15% Sr demonstrating significant antibacterial effects (complete MRSA inhibition at 50 μg/mL) and reduced ROS production in C. elegans. The study also noted improved hydroxyapatite formation and biofilm disruption.
population_specificity: In vitro (simulated body fluid, bacterial cultures) and C. elegans model.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic potential of strontium-doped bioactive glass incorporated into GelMA hydrogels for vital pulp therapy applications.
results_summary: The study found that strontium-doped hydrogels exhibited excellent cytocompatibility, supported cell adhesion, and demonstrated significant mineralization potential, with GelMA+BG5% showing the highest deposition of mineral nodules.
population_specificity: Dental pulp stem cells (DPSCs) in vitro.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and evaluate SrF2:Eu scintillating nanoparticles for efficient blue emission and their effectiveness in X-ray-activated photodynamic therapy (X-PDT) for cancer treatment.
results_summary: The study found that SrF2:Eu nanoparticles with TMPyP coating (SrF@6TMPyP) efficiently generated singlet oxygen upon X-ray irradiation, significantly reducing cancer cell survival in clonogenic assays. The 1O2 production was dose-dependent and more effective with low-energy X-rays compared to higher-energy gamma rays.
population_specificity: Cancer cells (in vitro)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether strontium ranelate (SR) could reverse or delay fusion-induced adjacent segment disc degeneration (ASDD) in an osteoporotic rat model.
results_summary: SR showed a protective effect on adjacent segment intervertebral discs by preserving bone mass, maintaining endplate vascular microstructure, and regulating matrix metabolism, potentially delaying ASDD progression in osteoporotic conditions.
population_specificity: Female Sprague-Dawley rats (3-month-old) with ovariectomy-induced osteoporosis and lumbar fusion.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical potential of a strontium-releasing 3D-printed titanium implant for repairing critical-sized, load-bearing bone defects.
results_summary: The strontium-loaded implant showed superior bone ingrowth, bonding strength, and preservation of native-like bone structure compared to untreated titanium implants, suggesting early and efficient bone repair.
population_specificity: Rabbit segmental diaphyseal defect model.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a novel synthesis technique for nanostructured electrodes using lanthanum strontium cobalt ferrite (LSCF) to improve the performance and stability of high-temperature solid oxide cells (SOCs).
results_summary: The study found that in situ polarization current treatment of LSCF nanoparticles on a GDC scaffold resulted in reduced electrode resistances, superior stability under fuel cell and electrolysis conditions, and a high peak power density of 1.58 W cm-2 at 750 °C. The convex-shaped interface between LSCF nanoparticles and the GDC scaffold contributed to these improvements.
population_specificity: Not applicable (materials science study, no human or animal subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the mechanisms of strontium (Sr) removal from water by nanofiltration (NF), focusing on the role of organic matter (OM) and pH.
results_summary: The study found that increasing OM concentration and varying pH levels enhanced Sr removal by 10-15%, primarily through size exclusion and Sr-OM interactions. Extremely low and high pH levels also improved Sr removal due to enhanced charge exclusion and Sr-OM interactions.
population_specificity: Not specified (water treatment context).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate changes in the double electrical layer in hydroxyapatite with incorporated strontium at the electrolyte solution interface.
results_summary: The study prepared adsorbents using dry and wet precipitation methods and analyzed surface characteristics, including specific surface area, surface charge density, and zeta potential. No direct biological or clinical effects of strontium were reported.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if doping strontium ranelate onto a TiO₂ nanotube layer on a Ti mesh could improve bone regeneration in bone defects.
results_summary: The study found that strontium ranelate-doped Ti mesh significantly increased osteoblast viability and improved new bone formation, with higher bone mineral density and bone volume compared to untreated Ti mesh. A bony bridge formed in rat calvarial defects, effectively closing the defect.
population_specificity: Rats with critical-size calvarial defects (Ф=8 mm).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether incorporating strontium-enriched amorphous calcium phosphate (Sr-ACP) granules into a collagen scaffold could improve subchondral bone repair in osteochondral defects.
results_summary: The study found that Sr-ACP enriched scaffolds significantly enhanced bone repair in a goat osteochondral defect model, particularly in weight-bearing areas, compared to scaffold-only treatment. The scaffolds demonstrated good cytocompatibility and biocompatibility in vitro and in vivo.
population_specificity: Goats with osteochondral defects (animal model).
effective_dosage: 30 wt% Sr-ACP granules (2.49 ± 0.04 wt% Sr concentration).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the antioxidant potential of biosynthesized strontium nanoparticles (SrNPs) with selenium and zinc oxide nanoparticles using DPPH and H2O2 assays.
results_summary: SrNPs demonstrated the highest antioxidant activity among the tested nanoparticles, with 90.12% inhibition in the DPPH assay and 87.43% inhibition in the H2O2 assay at 50 µL concentration. The study concluded that SrNPs synthesized using Acacia nilotica exhibit excellent free radical scavenging activity.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of Strontium Ranelate and Calcitonin in treating osteoporosis, particularly focusing on fracture prevention and bone mass effects.
results_summary: Strontium Ranelate demonstrated a dual effect of reducing bone resorption and increasing bone formation, significantly increasing bone mass and decreasing the risk of both vertebral and non-vertebral fractures. However, it was noted as a second-line therapy due to safety concerns and lack of advantages over other treatments.
population_specificity: Postmenopausal osteoporosis patients (implied, not explicitly stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of strontium ranelate/phytic acid-magnesium oxychloride cement composite for bone repair, focusing on its water resistance, biological activity, and bone-forming ability.
results_summary: The study found that strontium ranelate improved cell proliferation and osteoblast-related protein expression, enhanced water resistance, and demonstrated excellent bone-forming ability in rat models without inflammatory responses.
population_specificity: Rats (subcutaneous and femur implantation models)
effective_dosage: Not specified (1.25 wt% phytic acid-magnesium oxychloride cement was used as the base)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Strontium (Sr) reduces LPS-induced inflammation in bovine ruminal epithelial cells via the TLR4/MyD88/NF-κB pathway.
results_summary: Sr significantly decreased pro-inflammatory cytokines (TNF-α, IL-1β, IL-6), downregulated TLR4/MyD88/NF-κB pathway proteins, and reduced p-p65 and p-IκB fluorescence, demonstrating anti-inflammatory effects. High concentrations (≥ 10 mmol/L) reduced cell viability after 24 hours.
population_specificity: Bovine ruminal epithelial cells

study_goal: The researchers aimed to prepare and characterize strontium and copper co-substituted hydroxyapatite nanoparticles (SrCuHA Nps) and test their antibacterial efficacy when incorporated into orthodontic composite material.
results_summary: The SrCuHA Nps were successfully prepared and characterized. The SrCuHA-incorporated orthodontic composite demonstrated significant antibacterial efficacy, particularly against S. mutans at a higher concentration (40 μl), with comparable inhibition zones to the control group.
population_specificity: In vitro study (no human or animal subjects specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of oral strontium ranelate (SrR) on gut microbiome composition and metabolic profiles in ovariectomized rats as a model for postmenopausal osteoporosis.
results_summary: Oral SrR alleviated osteoporosis, significantly altered gut microbiome composition, and enriched specific bacteria like Ruminococcus albus, which correlated with increased bone mineral density and elevated metabolites (lycopene and glutaric acid).
population_specificity: Ovariectomized Sprague-Dawley rats (postmenopausal osteoporosis model).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the dual functionality of strontium cobaltite perovskite nanocomposites (SrCoO3/BN) for electrochemical detection and photocatalytic degradation of the herbicide mesotrione (MTN).
results_summary: The SrCoO3/BN nanocomposites demonstrated highly selective electrochemical detection of MTN with a low detection limit (11 nm), high sensitivity (3.782 μA μM-1 cm-2), and excellent stability, alongside 99% visible-light-driven photocatalytic degradation of MTN. The study also explored operational parameters and proposed mechanisms for detection and degradation.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro/environmental study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the biological effects and molecular mechanism of Strontium ranelate (SRR) on intervertebral disc degeneration (IVDD), focusing on its potential to mitigate inflammation and oxidative stress via the TGF-β1/NF-κB pathway.
results_summary: SRR promoted cell proliferation, reduced inflammation, and mitigated oxidative stress in human nucleus pulposus cells by upregulating TGF-β1 and suppressing the NF-κB pathway. In vivo results confirmed SRR's therapeutic potential for IVDD.
population_specificity: Human nucleus pulposus cells and degenerated human intervertebral disc tissues.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of strontium chlorate and strontium ranelate on bone microarchitecture in mice.
results_summary: Both strontium chlorate and strontium ranelate increased bone volume, trabecular thickness, trabecular number, and reduced trabecular separation compared to the control group, with no significant differences between the two compounds.
population_specificity: Healthy SWISS growing mice (n = 42)
effective_dosage: Strontium chlorate (7.532 mmol/L) and strontium ranelate (7.78 mmol/L) solutions

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the bone formation effects of a strontium-containing calcium phosphate bone cement with and without mesoporous bioactive glass (MBG) in osteopenic rats.
results_summary: The study found that strontium-containing cement with MBG (pS100G10) significantly enhanced bone formation and osteoconductivity compared to plain strontium cement (pS100) and empty defects, with improved gene expression markers for bone formation and reduced bone resorption indicators.
population_specificity: Ovariectomized Sprague-Dawley rats with induced osteopenia and metaphyseal fracture defects.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the biological performance of chitosan/bioglass composites enriched with SrO, focusing on cytocompatibility and ion release.
results_summary: The study found that composites with SrO-modified bioglasses showed higher cytocompatibility than those with ZnO but lower than nonmodified bioglasses. SrO-modified samples released Sr2+ ions and demonstrated bioactivity in simulated body fluid.
population_specificity: MG63 osteoblast-like cells (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a strategy using poly-L-aspartic acid‑strontium (PAsp‑strontium) and phosphate/fluoride could effectively and deeply occlude dentinal tubules for treating dentine hypersensitivity.
results_summary: The study found that PAsp‑strontium and phosphate/fluoride rapidly penetrated and occluded dentinal tubules up to 150 μm deep, with resistance to abrasive and acidic challenges, outperforming commercial desensitizers Duraphat and Gluma. The strategy also demonstrated biocompatibility and excellent in vivo performance.
population_specificity: Patients with dentine hypersensitivity (specific population details not provided).
effective_dosage: Application of PAsp‑strontium and phosphate/fluoride for 15 minutes each (exact concentrations not specified).
study_duration: Single application (15 minutes per occlusion medium).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how Strontium (Sr) affects bone quality and its potential mechanism through gut microbiome alterations in young individuals.
results_summary: Sr treatment improved bone biomechanical properties, microarchitecture, and osteoblast gene markers while reducing osteoclast markers. It also altered gut microbiome composition, with specific bacteria (e.g., Ruminococcaceae_UCG-014) linked to Sr's bone-protective effects.
population_specificity: 7-week-old male Wistar rats under normal growth conditions.
effective_dosage: SrCl2 solutions at 0, 100, 200, and 400 mg/kg body weight.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate calcium- and strontium-polyphosphate particles as potential drug carriers into articular cartilage, focusing on their physicochemical properties, cellular uptake, and biological effects.
results_summary: The study found that strontium-polyphosphate particles exhibited nanoscale size and negative zeta potential, were taken up by chondrocytes, and showed size- and concentration-dependent cytotoxicity at high concentrations. Treatment with these particles reduced chondrocyte proliferation and metabolic activity but demonstrated successful uptake in cartilage tissue explants.
population_specificity: Chondrocytes and cartilage tissue explants (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether incorporating calcium strontium silicate (CSR) into sodium fluoride (NaF) varnish enhances enamel remineralization and antimicrobial effects without cytotoxicity.
results_summary: The study found that 4% CSR+NaF varnish significantly improved fluoride release, enamel remineralization, and antimicrobial activity against Streptococcus mutans and Lactobacillus acidophilus, with no cytotoxic effects on HGF-1 cells.
population_specificity: Sound enamel specimens (in vitro study)
effective_dosage: 1%, 2%, and 4% w/v CSR in 5% NaF varnish

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how pH values affect the properties of strontium phosphate (Sr-P) coatings on titanium (Ti) and their potential applications in dentistry and orthopedics.
results_summary: The study found that Sr-P coatings on Ti improve corrosion resistance and biological properties, with phase composition and morphology varying by pH. The coatings also enhanced the adhesion and differentiation of BMSCs.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study on titanium substrates)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether strontium (Sr) could alleviate cadmium (Cd)-induced growth inhibition and toxicity in rice seedlings.
results_summary: Strontium (0.5 mg L-1) significantly reduced Cd-induced growth inhibition in rice seedlings, decreasing Cd accumulation and oxidative damage while modulating antioxidant enzyme activity and gene expression.
population_specificity: Rice seedlings (hydroponic conditions)

study_goal: To investigate the effect of strontium in drinking water on blood pressure in hypertensive mice and explore its potential mechanism.
results_summary: Strontium significantly reduced systolic and diastolic blood pressure in hypertensive mice, with higher doses showing greater effects. It also lowered levels of inflammatory markers and improved serum electrolyte balance.
population_specificity: Hypertensive ICR mice
effective_dosage: 2.5 mg/L, 5.0 mg/L, and 10.0 mg/L strontium in drinking water

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the remineralization potential of strontium-doped nanohydroxyapatite (SrnHAP) for early carious lesions compared to other remineralizing agents.
results_summary: The study synthesized five studies, showing SrnHAP's effectiveness in remineralizing enamel and dentin, with comparisons to other agents like nHAP, CPP-ACP, and NovaMin. X-ray diffraction, SEM, and TEM analyses confirmed hydroxyapatite formation and structural characterization.
population_specificity: Extracted human maxillary premolars (no in vivo human data).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the protective effects of strontium (Sr) on hippocampal damage in NAFLD mice and elucidate its underlying mechanisms.
results_summary: Sr treatment increased c-Fos+ cell density, suppressed endoplasmic reticulum stress (ERS), reduced neuroinflammation, attenuated microglia and astrocyte activation, and prevented synaptic damage in HFD-induced NAFLD mice.
population_specificity: High-fat diet-induced NAFLD mice

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether strontium titanate (SrTiO3) could improve the electrochemical performance and structural stability of Ni-rich cathode materials (NCM811) in lithium-ion batteries.
results_summary: The study found that SrTiO3 coating and interfacial Ti doping significantly enhanced the electrochemical performance of NCM811, achieving a high discharge capacity (188.5 mAh/g) and 90% capacity retention after 200 cycles. The dual modification strategy improved structural stability and Li+ diffusion rates.
population_specificity: Ni-rich layered structure ternary oxides (NCM811) in lithium-ion batteries.
study_duration: Performance evaluated over 200 cycles at 1C rate.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the physicochemical factors influencing the competition between Sr²⁺ and Ca²⁺ in protein binding sites to understand how Sr²⁺ displaces Ca²⁺.
results_summary: The study found that Ca²⁺-binding sites with multiple strong, rigid, and buried ligands resist Sr²⁺ displacement, while solvent-exposed, flexible sites with weak ligands are susceptible to Sr²⁺. The results provide a physical basis for Sr²⁺'s interaction with protein targets.
population_specificity: Not specified (theoretical study using density functional theory and polarizable continuum model).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether rearing fish in Sr-rich water induces sagittal vateritization in otoliths of the Japanese rice fish, Oryzias latipes.
results_summary: The study found that 70% of fish reared in Sr-rich water exhibited partial vateritization of sagittal otoliths, while none in normal tap water showed this effect. The vateritized phase had lower Sr2+ and higher Mg2+ concentrations compared to the aragonitic phase.
population_specificity: HdrR-II1 inbred strain of the Japanese rice fish (Oryzias latipes).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of Strontium (Sr) on calcium (Ca2+) metabolism in bovine rumen epithelial cells and identify potential regulatory targets.
results_summary: Sr increased intracellular Ca2+ levels and altered the expression of 770 mRNAs and 2436 proteins, with AHCYL2, SEMA3A, PTHLH, TGF-β2, and CYP11A1 identified as potential regulatory targets for Sr-mediated Ca2+ metabolism.
population_specificity: Bovine rumen epithelial cells isolated from newborn Holstein male calves (n = 3, 1 day old).
effective_dosage: IC50 of Sr treatment was 43.21 mmol/L for 24 hours.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of Strontium ranelate (SrR) and cerium oxide (CeO) on tibia quality in broilers, including bone mineral density, strength, and gene expression.
results_summary: The study found no significant influence of SrR and CeO on most bone quality metrics, but females showed increased bone strength in the combination group. Gene expression of osteocalcin (OC) increased with low SrR and CeO, while alkaline phosphatase (ALP) increased only in the combination group.
population_specificity: One-day-old Ross broiler chicks (384 total, divided into six treatment groups).
effective_dosage: SrR at 450 mg/kg and 900 mg/kg feed; CeO at 300 mg/kg and 600 mg/kg feed; combination of 450 mg/kg SrR + 300 mg/kg CeO.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the photocatalytic performance of SrFeO3@B-rGO nanocomposites for degrading tetracycline in environmental antibiotic wastewater.
results_summary: The SrFeO3@B-rGO nanocomposite achieved a 92% degradation rate of tetracycline in 75 minutes, with a high rate constant of 0.0211 min-1, demonstrating effective charge separation and radical generation. The study also confirmed the structural and functional properties of the nanocomposite through various analytical methods.
population_specificity: Environmental antibiotic wastewater (not human or animal subjects).
effective_dosage: 10 wt% B-rGO loading in the nanocomposite.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the capacity of thermally treated natural zeolite to remove Sr2+ ions from aqueous solutions.
results_summary: The study found that Sr2+ removal efficiency ranged between 51.3% and 94.5%, depending on initial concentrations, contact time, and adsorbent properties. Sorption kinetics followed the PSO model, indicating chemisorption dominated retention via strong coordinate bonds with the zeolite skeleton.
population_specificity: Aqueous solutions (in vitro study)
effective_dosage: Initial concentrations of 10, 50, and 100 mg L-1 Sr2+

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the biosorption capacity of Sargassum sp. for strontium (II) under varying conditions like temperature, pH, and biomass treatment.
results_summary: The study found that Sargassum sp. effectively adsorbed strontium (II), with optimal biosorption capacity reaching 103.95 mg/g under specific conditions. The Freundlich isotherm and pseudo-second-order kinetics model best described the adsorption process.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro study using algal biomass)
effective_dosage: Initial strontium concentration 300 mg/l, biosorbent dosage 0.1 g in 100 mL solution

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of Strontium ranelate (SR) on alveolar bone remodeling during orthodontic tooth movement and its underlying mechanism involving the NF-κB pathway and autophagy.
results_summary: SR reduced osteoclastogenesis, suppressed orthodontic tooth movement and root resorption in rats, and downregulated autophagy-related proteins and NF-κB pathway activity, with effects partially reversible by rapamycin.
population_specificity: Sprague-Dawley rats and in vitro pre-osteoclasts.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the use of strontium-90 in treating post-acne keloids, focusing on its safety, efficacy, and complications.
results_summary: The study reported extensive depigmentation in the maxillofacial region as a complication but noted that strontium-90 treatment was painless, non-invasive, and had a low recurrence rate. The abstract suggests a need to balance recurrence rates and complications.
population_specificity: Adolescents with post-acne keloids.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether gut microbiota mediates the effects of strontium on sperm quality and reproductive health in male rats, and to explore the underlying mechanisms.
results_summary: The Sr-50 group (50 mg/kg BW) significantly improved sperm concentration, motility, viability, testosterone levels, and testicular marker enzymes. Strontium treatment also altered gut microbiota composition but did not significantly correlate with sperm quality, possibly due to small sample size.
population_specificity: Male Wistar rats (6-8 weeks, 250 ± 20 g)
effective_dosage: 0, 50, 100, and 200 mg/kg BW of strontium chloride (SrCl2) solutions

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a composite bead material (CA@ZrP) for selectively capturing strontium (Sr2+) and cesium (Cs+) in low-pH and competing ionic environments.
results_summary: The study found that CA@ZrP exhibited improved adsorption performance for Sr2+ and Cs+ compared to pure zirconium phosphate, with treatment capacities of 404.79 and 302.2 bed volumes, respectively. The enhanced selectivity was attributed to the formation of a calcium-containing phase that facilitated ion exchange.
population_specificity: Not specified (laboratory study, no human or animal subjects mentioned).
effective_dosage: Not specified (adsorption performance evaluated under experimental conditions).
study_duration: Not specified (dynamic adsorption experiments conducted, but duration not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether in situ formed Sr-Ti-O species could enhance the photocatalytic properties of TiO2 semiconductors by stabilizing photogenerated charges.
results_summary: The study found that Sr-containing Cu/GO/TiNT composites showed improved photocatalytic kinetic response for formic acid degradation under UV irradiation, with dielectric properties indicating enhanced charge stabilization due to Sr-induced polarization.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro study on composite materials)
effective_dosage: Up to 1.0 wt% Sr incorporated into the composite

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if strontium (Sr), in combination with zinc (Zn) and magnesium (Mg), could enhance osteogenesis and antibacterial properties in titanium dental implants.
results_summary: The ZnSrMg-HAp group showed the highest induction of osteogenesis-associated genes (TNFRSF11B and SPP1) and effective antibacterial activity against periodontal pathogens, with prominent osteogenesis and bone growth along implant threads.
population_specificity: Human embryonic palatal mesenchymal cells (in vitro) and a rat animal model (in vivo).
study_duration: 7 and 11 days (in vitro), duration in vivo not specified

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the correlation between strontium (Sr) levels and acute kidney injury (AKI) following cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB) in clinical and animal studies.
results_summary: Higher preoperative serum Sr levels were associated with CPB-AKI in patients, and Sr-treated rats showed increased markers of kidney injury (SCr and BUN) compared to controls.
population_specificity: 74 cardiac surgery patients from Nagoya City University Hospital and Okazaki City Hospital, and rats in an animal model.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a strategy to mineralize collagen with Sr-doped hydroxyapatite (HA) using the PILP process to understand Sr doping in natural hard tissues and explore its potential for bone and tooth dentin regeneration.
results_summary: The study found that Sr doping altered the HA crystal lattice and inhibited mineralization in a concentration-dependent manner but did not affect intrafibrillar mineral formation. Sr-doped HA nanocrystals aligned differently compared to pure Ca HA, suggesting potential for biomimetic applications.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and evaluate strontium hexaferrite nanoparticles modified for combined diagnostic and therapeutic applications in radiopharmaceuticals.
results_summary: The study found that strontium hexaferrite nanoparticles coated with silicon dioxide and modified with specific ligands showed high stability and a radiolabeling yield of up to 99.8%, indicating potential as a theranostic radiopharmaceutical. In vitro experiments confirmed the stability of the complex for diagnostic and therapeutic use.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of strontium-doped calcium phosphate cement (SrCPC) enriched with tetracycline-functionalized hydroxyapatite nanoparticles (NP-TC) for antibacterial activity and tunable drug release in bone regeneration.
results_summary: The study found that NP-TC embedded in SrCPCs provided sustained and tunable tetracycline release, demonstrating effective bacteriostatic and bactericidal properties against Escherichia coli and Staphylococcus aureus. The results suggest potential for treating bone infections or cancers.
population_specificity: In vitro microbiological tests (bacterial strains, not human subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the potential of soluble soybean polysaccharides (SSPS) in reducing harmful HAs (heterocyclic amines) formation and improving meat product quality.
results_summary: SSPS reduced nonanal and hexanal content while increasing dimethyl trisulfide, dimethyl disulfide, and methional. It also inhibited HAs formation by 49% at 2.5% concentration, with glucose and fructose showing higher inhibitory rates (69%) compared to sucrose (44%) and SSPS (42%).
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro or chemical model systems used).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to characterize the role of PeSWEETs (sugar transporters) in passion fruit and evaluate their impact on sugar accumulation and stress response.
results_summary: The study found that PeSWEETs exhibit tissue-specific expression and are involved in sugar transport, with PeSWEET3 enhancing soluble sugar accumulation in transgenic tobacco. Exogenous ABA treatment upregulated PeSWEET3 expression and increased sugar accumulation.
population_specificity: Passion fruit (Passiflora edulis Sims) and transgenic tobacco plants.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how rapamycin affects feeding behaviors, specifically sugar intake, in Drosophila melanogaster.
results_summary: Rapamycin increased sugar intake in female flies in a dose-dependent manner, altering macronutrient preferences as early as the second day of exposure. These changes were influenced by sex and reproductive status, with no effects observed in males or sterile mutant females.
population_specificity: Female Drosophila melanogaster (fruit flies)
effective_dosage: Optimal life-extending dose (specific amount not provided)
study_duration: Short-term (as early as 2 days) and long-term administration

study_goal: The researchers aimed to understand the molecular mechanisms and gene networks involved in the response of Armillaria gallica to high temperature, particularly focusing on the role of sugar signaling in carbohydrate metabolism.
results_summary: The study found that sugar signaling, particularly in carbohydrate metabolism, plays a critical role in the rhizomorph response to high-temperature stress. A sucrose concentration of 30 g/L enhanced high-temperature resistance in A. gallica, with genes related to glycolysis up-regulated in the heat-tolerant strain.
population_specificity: Armillaria gallica (fungal strains GZ1 and SX8) and its symbiotic relationship with Gastrodia elata.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how alkaline treatment affects the mechanical, thermal, and morphological properties of sugar palm fiber-reinforced thermoplastic polyurethane composites.
results_summary: Alkaline treatment improved crystallinity, fiber-matrix compatibility, and thermal stability, with 2% NaOH optimizing flexural strength and 6% NaOH maximizing impact strength and thermal stability. Higher NaOH concentrations caused surface cracks but enhanced lignin removal.
population_specificity: Sugar palm fiber-reinforced thermoplastic polyurethane composites (in vitro study).
effective_dosage: Sodium hydroxide solutions of 0%, 2%, 4%, and 6% (w/w) applied for 90 minutes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the association between dietary sugar intake and the prevalence and severity of atopic dermatitis (AD) in children.
results_summary: The study found no significant association between dietary sugar and AD at ages 1-7, but at age 13, a 10% increase in dietary sugar as a proportion of total caloric intake was associated with a 22% increase in AD odds, with a dose-response relationship for severity (19% increase for mild AD, 32% for moderate-severe AD). The effect was limited to nonmilk extrinsic sugars.
population_specificity: Children from the Avon Longitudinal Study of Parents and Children (5372 participants, 50% female).
effective_dosage: Dietary sugar as a proportion of total caloric intake (specific amounts not provided).
study_duration: Longitudinal data collected at ages 1, 3, 5, 7, 10, and 13 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of osmotic dehydration using coconut sugar on drying kinetics and physicochemical properties of banana slices.
results_summary: Osmotic dehydration with coconut sugar increased drying rates and reduced drying times but caused higher shrinkage and color alteration while decreasing hardness. The study found that pretreatments maintained or increased flavonoid and phenolic compound levels, as well as antioxidant activity.
population_specificity: Banana slices (in vitro study, no human participants).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of individualized interventions in reducing diabetes distress and improving glycemic control using random blood sugar (RBS) as an alternative to HbA1c in individuals with uncontrolled type 2 diabetes mellitus.
results_summary: The study found that structured psychological and lifestyle counseling significantly reduced diabetes distress and improved RBS levels in the experimental group, while the control group showed increased distress and no significant change in RBS. A strong correlation was observed between reduced diabetes distress and improved glycemic outcomes.
population_specificity: 180 participants aged 18-65 years with uncontrolled type 2 diabetes mellitus.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how blue and red LED light treatments affect soluble sugar metabolism and carotenoid biosynthesis in postharvest nectarine fruit.
results_summary: Blue light treatment promoted sucrose accumulation by enhancing enzyme activities (SPS and SS-s) and up-regulated carotenoid biosynthesis genes, leading to increased carotenoid levels. Sucrose was positively correlated with carotenoid biosynthesis gene expression, suggesting a link between sugar metabolism and carotenoid production.
population_specificity: 'Zijinhong No. 3' nectarine fruit postharvest.
effective_dosage: Not specified (light treatment duration provided instead).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of Strontium Eucommia Ulmoides Polysaccharide (EUP-Sr) complexes in enhancing osseointegration and angiogenesis for dental implant applications.
results_summary: The study found that EUP-Sr-modified titanium implants exhibited no cytotoxicity, demonstrated anti-inflammatory properties, and improved osseointegration and angiogenesis, as confirmed by in vitro and in vivo evaluations.
population_specificity: Primary alveolar bone osteoblasts, macrophages, and vascular endothelial cells (in vitro); unspecified animal model (in vivo).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the metabolic effects of four sugar substitutes on glucose, lipid, and protein metabolism in a T2DM mouse model.
results_summary: Mogroside V (MOG), stevioside (ST), and erythritol (ERT) enhanced protein synthesis via the mTOR/p-P70S6K pathway, while MOG and ST improved glucose and lipid metabolism via the p-AMPK pathway. Sucralose primarily improved lipid metabolism by downregulating SREBP1, whereas ERT increased lipid droplet accumulation in the liver.
population_specificity: High-fat diet (HFD) combined with streptozotocin (STZ)-induced type 2 diabetic mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the association between intrauterine growth restriction (IUGR) and sugar consumption at two years of age in the BRISA cohort.
results_summary: The study found no association between IUGR and the percentage of energy intake from sugars, but infants without IUGR had lower total energy and gram intake of sugars compared to IUGR infants. This suggests fetal growth restriction may influence later sugar consumption preferences.
population_specificity: Mother-infant pairs from the BRISA cohort, with infants assessed at two years of age.
study_duration: Follow-up at two years of age

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the role of protein glycosylation in skin diseases, including its impact on tumor progression, immune regulation, and potential as a biomarker.
results_summary: The study found that abnormal glycosylation promotes tumor cell proliferation, migration, and immune evasion in skin cancers, while also influencing immune responses in inflammatory and autoimmune skin diseases. Glycosylation patterns correlate with disease severity and may serve as diagnostic or prognostic biomarkers.
population_specificity: Patients with melanoma, basal cell carcinoma, squamous cell carcinoma, psoriasis, systemic lupus erythematosus, dermatomyositis, and skin aging.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the association between sugar-sweetened beverage (SSB) consumption, weight-adjusted waist index (WWI), and psychological symptoms in adolescents.
results_summary: The study found that higher SSB consumption (>4 times/week) and higher WWI were significantly associated with increased risk of psychological symptoms in adolescents, with the highest risk group showing an OR of 2.01. Boys and girls both showed increased risk, though the effect was stronger in girls (OR=2.68).
population_specificity: 44,675 adolescents aged 12-17 years in mainland China.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the potential use of black carrot colorant liquid waste (BCLW) as a sugar source for glucose syrup substitution in gummy candy production.
results_summary: The study found that BCLW could effectively substitute glucose syrup in gummy candy, with higher hardness values observed when over 75% of BCLW was incorporated. Brightness remained high with up to 50% substitution, though accelerated shelf-life tests showed changes in color and hardness.
population_specificity: Not specified (industrial application for gummy candy production).
effective_dosage: Not specified (percentage substitution of glucose syrup with BCLW was tested at various levels).
study_duration: Not specified (accelerated shelf-life tests were conducted, but duration not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how drought conditions and the CsMYB1-CwINV6 module influence soluble sugar accumulation in citrus and tomato fruits.
results_summary: The study found that drought and ABA treatment increased transcript levels of CsMYB1 and CwINV6, promoting glucose and fructose accumulation in fruits. Overexpression of CsMYB1 or CwINV6 enhanced soluble sugar content, while silencing these genes had the opposite effect.
population_specificity: 'Nanfeng' tangerine fruits (Citrus reticulata) and 'Micro-Tom' tomato lines.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop an integrated algal-bacterial system for treating high-strength sugarcane wastewater by optimizing environmental parameters to enhance water purification and biomass yield.
results_summary: The study found that the integrated system achieved a COD removal efficiency of 98.56% and a biomass yield of 3.43 g/L under optimized conditions (aeration rate of 267 mL/min, light intensity of 6985 lx, and a 12:12 h light-dark photoperiod), demonstrating dual efficacy in organic load reduction and resource recovery.
population_specificity: Sugarcane wastewater (not human or animal subjects)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore social contextual influences on dietary sugar consumption among public housing residents in Boston, MA.
results_summary: The study identified multiple influences on dietary sugar consumption, including individual preferences, social environment, physical environment, and macro environment, with cultural and home centrality being key factors. Approximately half of participants reported daily consumption of sugar-sweetened beverages.
population_specificity: Adult residents of two public housing developments in Boston, predominantly women identifying as Hispanic (61.2%) or non-Hispanic Black (30.6%).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the mosquitocidal activity of isoxazoline derivatives (afoxolaner, fluralaner, lotilaner) and the impact of antibiotic treatment and different carbohydrates in artificial nectar meals on their potency.
results_summary: The study found that all tested isoxazolines showed rapid mosquitocidal effects with little variation between mosquito species, with fluralaner being the most potent. Antibiotic treatment and variations in sugar diet did not affect isoxazoline potency.
population_specificity: Anopheles gambiae s.s, Anopheles coluzzii, Aedes aegypti, and Anopheles funestus mosquitoes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the association between dietary sugar intake and quality of life (QoL) in healthy children and adolescents.
results_summary: The review found adverse associations between sugar intake and various QoL dimensions, including food security, sleep, oral health, and mental health, with 20 out of 21 studies reporting negative effects.
population_specificity: Healthy children and adolescents aged 4 to 19 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the association between body roundness index (BRI), sugar-sweetened beverage (SSB) consumption, and psychological symptoms in Chinese adolescents.
results_summary: Higher BRI and SSB consumption were significantly associated with increased risk of psychological symptoms, with the highest risk group (BRI quartile Q4 and SSB consumption ≥4 times/week) showing an OR of 2.01. The prevalence of psychological symptoms was 19.2%, with emotional and behavioral problems being the most common.
population_specificity: Chinese adolescents aged 12-18 years (n=47,520) from six geographic regions.
effective_dosage: SSB consumption categorized as ≤1 time/week, 2-3 times/week, and ≥4 times/week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how chitooligosaccharides (COS) enhance resistance to black-shank disease in tobacco by regulating sugar homeostasis and recruiting beneficial microorganisms.
results_summary: COS treatment increased sugar-related metabolites (trehalose, trehalose 6-phosphate, sucrose, glucose) and beneficial microorganisms (e.g., Bacillus), enhancing resistance to P. nicotianae.
